reviewText: Was expecting nothing from this. Installed and played figuring one and done.  No!  An overhead twin stick shooter centered on an upgradeable tank complimented with earned custom loadouts.  Enemy engagement of Nazi war machines whose destruction results in frequent gold and occasional weapon drops.  24 levels of varied primary and secondary objectives make iBomber Attack a great value.  Filing this under hidden gems.
voteText: 40 of 46 people (87%) found this review helpful

reviewText: If you're looking for a quick, no frills, top-down tank shooter then this fits the bill.  Plenty of destruction, weapon upgrades and has a few different types of scenarios.  I got about 5 hours of gameplay out of it.  You'll probably get more if you want to master every level.  Graphically it is to be expected at this price range.  Not a ton of replay value, as soon as I beat it I was good, but fun temporary time killer.
voteText: 12 of 12 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
★★★★★


I haven't given too many games a 5 star rating, but this game sure does deserve one. I can't believe how one game can get me to invest so many hours in one sitting. This rarely occurs for me due to health reasons. Sitting that long. The gameplay is outstanding, graphics, sound, music, everything. And this is a port? I'm surprised. I believe I've reached level 14 and there's much more to go and it just gets better with every completed level. Don't pass this one up if you like destroying everything. Worth a play for sure. UPDATE: I forgot to include the tip, to make sure you use a controller because it's so much easier on your hands and switching between weapons. And it never crashed on me once after completing the single player campaign, unlike some AAA titles out there. If you're running Linux? Check the forums for the game starting properly too.
voteText: 7 of 7 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: iBomber Attack is the best of the iBomber series.
voteText: 8 of 10 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText: An uncomplicated, destructive and addictive game. When I'm in the mood for this type of game I just keep going level after level. Probably the best 2D tank game I've come across and the particle effects are pretty good. It takes a while to get used to controlling the tank but once mastered you forget about it. Nice albeit simple upgrading system too. Plays perfectly on a Ubuntu laptop with intel graphics so doesn't need much.
voteText: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
A nice throwback to titles like Return Fire or Mass Destruction - iBomber Attack is family-friendly glorification of violence and destruction in a Weird War II-setting. Get in your tank, blow Wehrmacht up, upgrade your tank, blow more Wehrmacht up - missions do have various primary and secondary objectives, but it all boils down to victory through superior firepower" (which is A-okay by me).

The warzones are rendered in a nice 2D style (with some nice attention to detail too) and accompanied by lots of gun- and explosion-sfx which have a decent oomph to them. Probably runs on a Toaster and works very well with a controller.

Once you upgraded your tank enough
date: you are like a force of nature laying waste to entire cities which is stupidly fun. Not really a clever game by any stretch of the imagination otherwise (and pretty much on the "not challenging"-end of the difficulty-spectrum)
recommended: but very entertaining if you crave some good old top-down destruction with a twinstick-shooter twist (pretty much everything in a level can be destroyed
helpfulPercent: set on fire... you get the idea!)."
commentsCount: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Just under 9 hours played.. beat the game a couple times, all achievements (not many, which can be good or bad depending on how you feel about them). Probably won't play it again, but you never know. The game is quite enjoyable. The level sizes are decent although unless you're going for achievements you don't really go all over the map in most levels.  I never used a controller for this game, as it's far more smooth driving then say Renegade Ops, but I could see it being nice so I leave that to personal preference.

The power-ups and upgrades are definitely cool, as I found out you will probably use most of them a couple times depending on the level. The side missions are a nice touch as well.

The simplicity of this game is great, it's a straight forward game and really easy to pick up. The only flaw I see with this is long term replay value.

7.5/10 due to no long term replay value but very much worth it especially on sale
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: A well-done take on the twin-stick shooter.  The game doesn't take that long to beat, but it's good fun while it lasts.  You drive a tank through many missions, killing nazi troops, vehicles, buildings, choosing different upgrades/purchases after each mission.\n\nOne small issue is that progress isn't saved until you exit the game (and syncs to the cloud), so if you experience a game crash (which I did once) you can lose quite a bit of progress.

reviewText: If you want some action and fun, I would bet that this game will give you that and more. I bought it thinking it would not be as good, but then be downloaded and played the first two missions, became somewhat addictive.
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Fun game and easy to play. Time or no time. Its all up to you. Thats a nice touch. Finally a game that you can tailor how you want to play it. What an idea. The graphics are good and clean looking. I played it with an xbox controller. Sound is good as well. I liked this game a lot more then I thought I would. The game has upgrades like better speed and such and alternate weapons like a bomb strike and a machine gun. Very good. 8/10 not deep but a good arcade shoot em up.

I had a lot of fun playing iBomber Attack, but on several occasions the game has suddenly crashed and dumped me to my Windows Desktop. This alone is not the reason I am leaving a negative review, as even great games can have a hiccup from time to time. The problem is that after each crash I have lost a lot of progress - missions that I had completed were no longer complete and money / skill points I had earned were gone.  The game does not have a manual save feature as far as I know, and if autosave is the only option then it should autosave after each mission attempt. The crashes were not frequent, but for me that isn't the point. This is a sloppy game design and programming choice in a game that is otherwise well crafted.  If this problem were to be addressed I would certainly reccomend this game, but as it stands I don't think the game is worth putting in time that can be too easily lost.

A quality title from Cobra Mobile. You play an allied tank in WWII with your tasks varying from level to level but always include mowing down the nazis. The game seemed to slow down in fullscreen view but played nice windowed. It's got plenty of levels and the game remains really playable throughout. Playing on the harder difficulty makes it quite challenging towards the end. I think the top-down graphics suit the game well. Good stuff.

Wow took A chance with this game because It reminded me Of A game I played when I was A kid called Jakal on the Nintendo Was one of my favorites when I was Young. $1.79 on sale. If you like tanks and blowing stuff up,upgrades,and leveling up your tanks this Is a awesome game. 2 Thumbs up.

reviewText: This is a perfect little game. If you're looking for a casual game that you really don't have to put your mind into too much - this is your choice. You can play the game through by being sloppy and straight-forward or if you're up to it you can go all-perfect on it. I have put somewhat twelve hours into this game and that was just the single-player campaign - with all Steam achievements collected, though. The game offers some replay value by giving you an arcade challenge mode, too.

reviewText: For what it is, this game is pure perfection. It's a top-down one-hero-against-the-whole-German-army shooter with very intuitive controls (it's very easy to steer the tank in any direction, drive forward and backwards, all while pointing the turret right at the target), varied missions, primary and secondary objectives, optional hidden objectives, reasonable upgrade system and most imporantly - loads of fun! All that for a very decent price which tends to go unreasonably low on occassions. If you remember the golden age of top-down shooters, you'll love it!
this game is alot of fun and i keep going back to it,i hope they make more ibomber games because im hooked
Deserves respect; Has a GTA2 feel to it

The misleadingly named iBomber Attack is a game that has nothing to do with bombers, and everything to do with tanks. Specifically, it involves tanks blowing up lots and lots of stuff from a top-down point  of view.

This is not a game with revolutionary graphics. It does not have an engaging storyline. There is no music and most sound effects consist of explosions.

And yet, it is fun.

There's just something addictive about systematically blasting a building to pieces to get at an enemy on the other side. Or blasting anything to pieces really, since almost anything you encounter can be destroyed. You may start out in a pristine rural village with cobblestone streets and majestic fountains. Rest assured, by the time you've finished the level the whole place will be a smoking ruin - hells yeah!

The controls are easy to master. You do get the ability to buy various upgrades and weapons for your tank as you complete missions.

The game is single-player only, with both a campaign and a survival mode. You're looking at several solid hours worth of mindless entertainment for a reasonable price (I bought the game for one dollar).

An enjoyable little top down action game, drive around a tank blowing stuff up, and earning money for weapons and upgrade points. Takes about 10 hours to beat the game at 100% with full achievements. I got it on sale and got my moneys worth. I wrote up a small guide to getting 100% on lvl 21since its a timed level.
A game worth it if you have a crappy computer.
Simple and easy to pick up. A game you can leisurely return to when you are not quite in the mood for the big bulkiness of a premium game or only have about 10 minutes to spend.

If you have played iBomber games before than you know what you can expect from the graphics side of things. The gameplay is a lot different however. You're not the blowing up things as in a tower defense game, but you're now in the driverseat. The game has some depth that you will be able to upgrade you're tank. For the rest it's making sure you hit the enemy with you gun. Wouldn't put this game at the top of my shopping list, but it definetly offers some simple good old fun.
Cant stop playing this game. Just something about ATTACKing bring out the best. Must buy

A gorgeous top down two stick shooter from my favorite gaming company!  Simply said, the best of its kind!  It's incredibly fun to drive around the beautiful destructable maps shooting bad guys.  The price is great too so if you like 2d action games, this is the best you can get.
this game is easy deasy lemon squeezy
oui

It was aight. Top-down action game controlling a tank blasting through Nazi lines. There's 24 levels which gives it a fair amount of gameplay for the price. Points are given for blowing up all the stuff, completing secondary objectives and collcting stuff. These points can be used to upgrade the tank and alternate weapons can be obtained. There isn't much variety in the enemies. As levels progress there are slight variations on the same thing and they take more shots to kill. The graphics style is high-resolution rendering of very basic models. This game would've been just fine on the NES. It even reminds me of Jakyl (but not as good). There was an annoying bug I encountered that hurts my opinion of the game. In level 20 there is a timed objective that I failed. When failure occurs the game crashed. When I loaded it back up it erased all my progress from level 13 up to that point and I had to replay it all again. So, after every level, I'd quit the game and restart. The bug happened again on level 20, but thankfully when I reloaded it, I only had to replay level 20 again. Overall, this game is average for a budget title. It's also on phones so that should give you a good idea as to the quality of it.
An excellent (and very affordable) top-down shooter with plenty in the mix between weapon and armor upgrades, challenges, objectives, solid controls, and varied enemies and terrain.
good manybe tank is much good but tank style is too little

This game is a lot of fun and I find myself going back to replay missions to try to perfect my scores. The controls are a little wobbly and take some getting used to, but all in all it is a solid and fun game!

Don't be fooled by the name. Although iBomber Attack is developed by the same company, this is completely a different game from iBomber defense (and iBomber defense pacific). iBomber attack is a shooting game, in which you control a small tank to eliminate an entire Nazi army. Some of the graphical and acoustic materials are inspired by iBomber defense, and the overall performances of graphic and sound are just so so. Surprisingly, the game is actually additive with its well balanced numeral value design, which makes the difficulty increases at a comfortable slope and encourages you to continue completing missions (as well as secondary objectives and collectibles) and strengthen your vehicle.
About 8 hours are needed to accomplish all achievements and there are still time challanges (not counting towards any achievement) that demand quite a skill and planning even if your tank is nearly fully equipped.

Recommended for anyone who does not hate shooting games.
Buy this if you get it on sale. It's a fun little arcade but it's not worth 6 euros.
Very nice casual game.\n

I expected a mobile game with little no depth. The opening menu and options are very mobile like, but don't let that full you. This game is pretty great. It plops you on a large map with non-linear objectives. If you like mindless shooting, this game will be great for you.

This isn't my usual type of game; I got it in a bundle recently and since it was there I decided I might as well try it out anyway.  I was pleasantly surprised.  It's simple enough not to even need any instructions (which is good since there aren't any) and pretty much just mindless fun running over entire towns with your tank and shooting everything in sight.  Given this isn't my usual genre and I usually don't get that far in these types of games, I wouldn't exactly say there's much challenge to the game, especially for people who are better at games than I am, but if that doesn't bother you, you should definitely check it out!

Graphics : 5/10
Music : 5/10
Gameplay : 5/10
Story : 5/10

Overall : 5/10
